Author: JimD#9272
Content: Does barter dex report volume on major exchanges or could you do atomic swaps all day at whatever price and not effect the price on major exchanges ?

Author: Cryptoon#3362
Content: @siu - Chainmakers what does it mean in laymenâ€™s terms?

Author: Cryptoon#3362
Content: If volume is high enough arbitrage will occur and prices will move to the same price as on major exchanges @JimD

Author: JimD#9272
Content: whats the mechanism for that arbitrage though

Author: JimD#9272
Content: if I buy and hold and don't sell how would anyone know what price I atomic swapped at

Author: Cryptoon#3362
Content: People buy low on one place and sell higher on the other

Author: Cryptoon#3362
Content: Price will move to equilibrium

Author: Cryptoon#3362
Content: Lets say for example someone is buying btc/kmd at a higher rate than on cex

Author: Cryptoon#3362
Content: People will buy on cex and sell on dex

Author: Cryptoon#3362
Content: Pushing up the price on cex because of buying

Author: Cryptoon#3362
Content: And dropping price on dex because of selling

Author: JimD#9272
Content: ya, I thought something like that is possible

Author: JimD#9272
Content: do what you want to be seen on cex and do what needs to be hidden on dex

Author: ComputerGenie ğŸ‘´ğŸ¼ğŸ“¢#7004

Author: JimD#9272
Content: how does market buy work on barter dex

Author: JimD#9272
Content: people just put in their sell orders and it matches it up ?

Author: ComputerGenie ğŸ‘´ğŸ¼ğŸ“¢#7004
Content: you, quite literally, can't hide anything on a peer-2-peer live-blockchain tranfer system

Author: ComputerGenie ğŸ‘´ğŸ¼ğŸ“¢#7004
Content:
there's some behind the scenes math about how matches are made, but yes...
you post an offer and if someone else likes it, then they bid on it in return (like an auction)

Author: ComputerGenie ğŸ‘´ğŸ¼ğŸ“¢#7004
Content: that's the beauty in the simplicity of it all: until you send your coins out for an active trade, they are yours and you can offer to whoever for whatever

Author: ComputerGenie ğŸ‘´ğŸ¼ğŸ“¢#7004
Content: CEXs don't do that because they are no longer your coins and all you have is a balance on a ledger

Author: siu - Chainmakers#3920
Content: @Cryptoon what you mean about what it means in leymens terms?

Author: siu - Chainmakers#3920
Content: the whitelisted pubkeys?

Author: Cryptoon#3362
Content: Yes

Author: siu - Chainmakers#3920
Content: The komodo notary nodes are nodes with special priviledge to notarize and easy mining in the komodo network

Author: siu - Chainmakers#3920
Content: The way you set that privilege on the blockchain is adding the pubkeys to the core code

Author: siu - Chainmakers#3920
Content: In the EOS chain it works in a similar way

Author: siu - Chainmakers#3920
Content: people vote for the 21 pubkeys that can be block producers

Author: siu - Chainmakers#3920
Content: in that case, people constantly vote to put or remove those privileges to the different pubkeys

Author: siu - Chainmakers#3920
Content: In the case of this bitcoin fork with a government strapon attached to it, 200 pubkey where added to the core code to have the privilege of being the only miners in the network.

Content: https://www.businesswire.com/news/home/20180821005217/en/Regulated-Bitcoin-Fork-XBR-LLC-Files-U.S
